elements.title: Maria Advocata (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Maria Advocata (pictured) is one of the oldest icons of Mary, mother of Jesus, and that according to legend it was painted by Luke the Evangelist?

elements.title: Armwell Long (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Delaware politician Armwell Long was said to have once outranked his close friend, George Washington?

elements.title: revenge buying (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that revenge buying after the lifting of a 2020 COVID-19 lockdown helped a Hermès store set a record for the most shopping at a luxury outlet in China in a single day?

elements.title: Harvey Shapiro (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that cellist Harvey Shapiro played at the 50th anniversary of his professional debut despite broken ribs and a torn muscle incurred from a fall a few days prior?

elements.title: AFL Women's season seven Grand Final (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that at the conclusion of the AFL Women's season seven Grand Final, winning captain Daisy Pearce placed her premiership medal on a young girl?

elements.title: Death in Small Doses (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the film Death in Small Doses is a dramatization of the real-life death of Nancy Lyon by arsenic poisoning?

elements.title: Aspar Aswin (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the impeachment proceedings against West Kalimantan Governor Aspar Aswin were shelved after an ethnic riot broke out?

elements.title: Neotrombicula fujigmo (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the mite Neotrombicula fujigmo gets its name from the American military acronym for "Fuck you, Jack, I got my orders"?
